subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: WARNING!! WARNING!!
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
I believe an investigator who honestly means no harm to anyone or anything 
while on an investigation will not be harmed or even threatened. I have 
been in cemeteries where I felt "watched" by something and possibly felt
threatened a bit. If I do something like straighten or right a fallen 
tombstone, I've noticed the threatened feeling to disappear.

It's as if that simple action convinced someone that you are OK.

Zack

On Tue, 15 Apr 2008, April Slaughter wrote:

> While I think it is always a good idea to keep a positive energy about
> oneself, I honestly do not believe the box (in its many forms) is
> anymore dangerous than other tools used in paranormal research. I have
> never been harmed by a spirit, whether it be in working in EVP-ITC
> research, or other phenomena and I too have been doing this a long time.
>
